definition[0]: to change the appearance, sound, or shape of something so that it is strange or unclear
example[0]: Tall buildings can distort radio signals.
definition[1]: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct
example[1]: His account was badly distorted by the press.
definition[2]: to change a situation from the way it would naturally be
example[2]: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
